name: @surf_to_vol_spackle
author: AFNI Developers
description: Project data from a surface dataset into a volume primarily using 3dSurf2Vol but then filling any holes with an iterative smoothing procedure.

inputs.description: Mask dataset in which to project surface measures.
inputs.name: Mask Set

inputs.description: Surface specification file with list of surfaces.
inputs.name: Surface Spec

inputs.description: Name of the first surface, e.g., smoothwm, pial, etc.
inputs.name: Surface A

inputs.description: Name of the second surface. If not included, computes using normal vector.
inputs.name: Surface B

inputs.description: Basename of output. Final name used is prefix.nii.gz.
inputs.name: Prefix

inputs.description: Normal vector length if only using a single surface (default 2 mm).
inputs.name: Normal Vector Length

inputs.description: Radius for search for mean to fill holes (default 2 mm).
inputs.name: Search Radius

inputs.description: Number of steps on line segments (default 10).
inputs.name: Number of Steps

inputs.description: Do not remove any of the temporary files (default is to remove them).
inputs.name: Keep Temporary Files Flag

inputs.description: Maximum number of smoothing and filling iterations (default is 4).
inputs.name: Max Iterations

inputs.description: Use mode instead of non-zero median (appropriate for ROIs).
inputs.name: Use Mode Flag

inputs.description: Set datum type to byte, short, or float instead of maskset type. Mode triggers -datum short.
inputs.name: Datum Type

inputs.description: Ignore additional options that are not needed.
inputs.name: Ignore Unknown Options Flag

output-files.description: The primary output volume file with surface measures projected.
output-files.name: Output Volume
